citation.article-title: Sulfitobacter litoralis sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from the East Sea, Korea
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sulfitobacter litoralis sp. nov.
Sulfitobacter litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. masc. adj. litoralis of the shore).
Colonies are uniformly round, smooth and slightly yellowish after incubation for 48 h on MA.
Cells are Gram-negative, short rods and are motile by means of polar flagella.
Growth occurs at 4–30 °C, with an optimum at 20 °C.
Halophilic; NaCl [1.0–10.0 % (w/v); optimum 6.0–7.0 % (w/v)] is required for growth.
Glucose, arabinose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, gluconate, caprate, citrate and phenylacetate are not utilized, but mannitol, adipate and malate are utilized.
The principal cellular fatty acids are 18 : 1ω7c (85.6 %) and 11-methyl 18 : 1ω7c (9.1 %).
The type strain, Iso 3T (=KCTC 12521T=DSM 17584T), was isolated from a water sample obtained from the East Sea, Korea.
